page.title: 01Craignaw Area Galloway Hills
page.content: Remote uninhabited boggy peat upland dominated by central north-south granite ridge. Bare rock pavements on summits, Craignaw 645m. Snibe Hill 533m. in east ridge drops precipitously 1000 ft into rounded Doon/Dee glacial trough with spectacular waterfall, Dow spout. East side of trough planted with forestry in west side, two lochs of Dungeon and Silver Flowe nature reserve, a complex of 7 patterned mires stretching along floor of valley, in North West a broken plateau, Craig Neldricken 552m,overlooks rock basin lake Loch Enoch 495m, and Loch Arron. Glacial valley containing Loch Neldricken 345m leads south from Nick of the Dungeon 494m. Ice Breached col in ridge. Flora dominated by purple moor grass with heathers and bog myrtle. Area rich in mountain wildlife, red deer and feral
